column3: Dr. Root, a Nobel Peace Prize Award co-winner, will speak about the damaging effects of #microplastics in an event called “Innocent Victims: Impact of Plastic on Wildlife” this Friday, April 12 at 6:30PM at Congregational United Church in Punta Gorda. #GCL https://t.co/MZQYyA7Smk

Who cleans up the nearly invisible pieces of plastic floating around bodies of water? Today at 1PM on WGCU-FM's #GCL, we're joined by Dr. Terry Root, a @StanfordWoods senior fellow emerita, to discuss the impact #microplastics have on #wildlife. https://t.co/MZQYyA7Smk
If you would like to add your voice to our conversation, give us a call now: 1-877-428-8255, or tweet @WGCU using #GCL. #microplastics https://t.co/MZQYyA7Smk

#Plastic #pollution is projected to reach 2,500 Empire State Buildings worth in our oceans by 2050. It's killing huge amounts of sea life and is breaking down into #microplastics and is already in our food. Today is a great day for you to stop using single-use plastics! #ActNow https://t.co/G2uE3Ef2eF

We are literally killing #life in the #oceans with our #plastic fetish. Massive amounts of mammals, fish and birds are killed by large pieces of plastic. The big pieces break down into #microplastics and pollute the entire food chain. And it's going to get MUCH MUCH WORSE. https://t.co/2qut3b1ECA

#WetTribe method for measuring microplastis based not only on density gradient, but marine level; flotation (ocean surface), suspension (water column), and sedimentation (sea bottom) - the primary measurement property of the distribution and bioavailability of #microplastics. https://t.co/kuNjPcWZkP

April is #EarthMonth so #WetTribe is out in the field showing "Plastic is more than Pollution" – We’re documenting #PlasticPollution and #Microplastics effects on coastal ecosystems. https://t.co/DzpzhnWWiu

The #ocean is full of #microplastics and it can be difficult to identify where the #plastic came from, is part of a #WaterBottle or #FishingGear? #Scientists are also hoping to determine the origin of #OceanMicroplastics by looking at their #chemistry. #WetTribe #tidetotheocean https://t.co/O53TJ3l4YE

column3: Global study of #Microplastics - the sum is used to accumulate the ‘particles per cubic meter’ value and the count is incremented for each sample until it indicates that the array is full. #WetTribe #tidetotheocean https://t.co/NqXZEXU29u

Millions of tons of #plastic are dumped into the ocean each year, along with lost and abandoned #GhostNets - where does it come from, where does it end up? #WetTribe is deploying drones to help us find, document, and target it for #OceanRecovery and/or #BeachCleanup. https://t.co/y7QbRyl7lA

Tons of #plastic enter the #ocean, yet only a fraction remains visible on the surface – #WetTribe #researchers are closer to determining where "missing plastic" end up, using an unprecedented global effort to track and remove #OceanPlastic. #OpenLitterMap https://t.co/29HSkQ2Jml
